Subject. I /00-tJ/V v ty coi ENCLOSURE IN V/tEKLY LETTER No. 4 6 17 NOV. 1932 FROM SECRETARY, POLITICAL AND SECRET DEPT. INDIA OFFICE Similar letter sent toCopy No.1023. (E 5708/5122/34) Sir, I have the honour to transmit to you, for information, a copy of the papers noted “below on the subject of Dr. Naji al Asil. I have, etc., (Sgb) HUBERT YOUNG. HIS MAJESTY’S PRINCIPAL SECRETARY OF STATE FOR FOREIGN AFFAIRS. Description. Despatch No.8432 to His Majesty s Minister, Tehran (with enclosure). Date 20th October, 1932. ( 67 ;: 3 1 193? BRITISH LEGATION, BAGHDAD, 20th October, 1932.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence for this description (used for referencing) commences at f 115, and terminates at f 119, as it is part of a larger physical volume; these numbers are written in pencil, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 116-119; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: The file consists of correspondence from the British Legation, Baghdad (Hubert Young) to HM Minister, Tehran with information about the newly appointed Iraqi Consul, Mohammerah (Dr Naji Al Asil).

name.namePart: Permanent Under-Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs
